meanings.definition: The quality or state of being relevant.
meanings.sent1: The relevancies of the evidence were clear in the court case.
meanings.sent2: She always focuses on the relevancies of the topic during discussions.
meanings.sent3: The relevancies of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His speech was full of relevancies that captured the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the relevancies of the lesson helped the students remember the key points.

meanings.definition: Something that is relevant or pertinent.
meanings.sent1: The professor highlighted the relevancies of the research findings.
meanings.sent2: Please only include the relevancies in your report.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the relevancies in the mysterious clues.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was like a beacon, pointing out the relevancies in the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The relevancies of the new policy were immediately apparent to everyone.
